Instruction: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius).
Combine, in a large mixing bowl, all-purpose flour, salt, and baking soda. Add whole wheat flour and sugar into the bowl; stir to incorporate. In a separate bowl, combine buttermilk, milk, and oil.
Mix the milk mixture into the flour mixture until combined. Divide the dough in half and shape into two round, flat loaves on a lightly greased baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes, then lower the heat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and continue baking for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown.
